title: Forwarding Yahoo Mail to a Gmail Account: Step-by-Step Guide

steps.title: Subscribe to Yahoo Mail Plus or Yahoo Access+ Forwarding.
steps.content: Subscribe to Yahoo Mail Plus or Yahoo Access+ Forwarding. If you have a free Yahoo Mail account, you won't be able to forward your email to your Gmail account. To access email forwarding, you will need to subscribe to Yahoo Mail Pro or Access+ Forwarding. [1] X Research source Yahoo Mail Plus comes with other features, such as an ad-free inbox and more storage. A subscription is currently $5/month. [2] X Research source If you don't need the added features, you can opt for Yahoo Access+ Forwarding, which just adds the email forwarding feature to your Yahoo account. You'll pay just $12/year with this option. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open your Yahoo Mail settings.
steps.content: Open your Yahoo Mail settings. Go to https://mail.yahoo.com in your web browser and log in if you haven't already. Then, click the three horizontal dots at the bottom of the left column and select Settings . If you're using the old version of Yahoo Mail, click the gear icon at the top-right, then click More Settings . [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click Mailboxes.
steps.content: Click Mailboxes . You will see this option in the left panel.

steps.title: Select the Yahoo email address you want to forward to Gmail.
steps.content: Select the Yahoo email address you want to forward to Gmail. To do this, just click the address under "Mailbox list" in the center panel.

steps.title: Enter your Gmail address under "Auto-forwarding."
steps.content: Enter your Gmail address under "Auto-forwarding." You can only do this if you have upgraded your Yahoo Mail account to Yahoo Mail Plus. [5] X Research source If you haven't upgraded, the only option under "Auto-forwarding" will be the option to upgrade. Make sure this isn't a Gmail address you have linked to your Yahoo account.

steps.title: Click Verify.
steps.content: Click Verify . It's a blue button to the right of your Gmail address. This will prompt Yahoo to send a verification email to your Gmail address.

steps.title: Click Save to save your changes.
steps.content: Click Save to save your changes. You'll complete the rest of the steps in Gmail.

steps.title: Verify your Gmail address.
steps.content: Verify your Gmail address. To do so: Open your Gmail inbox and log in if necessary. Open the verification email from Yahoo. If you don't see it, you may need to look in the Spam folder. Click the link in the email. Follow the on-screen instructions to finish verifying your Gmail account. Once verified, all emails sent to your Yahoo Mail email address will be forwarded to your Gmail account.

steps.title: Log in to Gmail on a computer.
steps.content: Log in to Gmail on a computer. If you donâ€™t want to pay to have your Yahoo Mail forwarded to Gmail, another option is to add your Yahoo account to Gmail so you can receive future Yahoo Mail messages in your Gmail inbox. Just log in to Gmail.com using any web browser to get started.

steps.title: Open your Gmail settings.
steps.content: Open your Gmail settings. Click the gear icon at the top-right corner of Gmail, then click See all settings .

steps.title: Click the Accounts and Import tab.
steps.content: Click the Accounts and Import tab. It's at the top of your settings.

steps.title: Click Add a mail account.
steps.content: Click Add a mail account . You'll see this next to "Check mail from other accounts."

steps.title: Enter your Yahoo email address and click Next.
steps.content: Enter your Yahoo email address and click Next . You can also add other email accounts to Gmail, including Outlook.com, your work email, your school email, and more.

steps.title: Select Link accounts with Gmailify and click Next.
steps.content: Select Link accounts with Gmailify and click Next . This option makes it so you can receive your Yahoo Mail messages in your Gmail inbox without having to forward your email from Yahoo. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click Agree to agree to the terms.
steps.content: Click Agree to agree to the terms. If you're not signed in to Yahoo, you may be prompted to do so as well. This will complete the linking process. You will still be able to log in to your Yahoo Mail account and check your email there as well. This means you'll have copies of the same messages in both places. If you're worried about running out of space in your Yahoo account, be sure to log back in and delete unneeded messages often.
